[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Personal Calendar Management System (PCMS) allows users to manage events, appointments, and schedules efficiently, ensuring seamless planning and reminders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PCMS enables users to create, view, edit, delete, and share personal events. It includes features for syncing with other calendars and managing availability.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PCMS integrates with external calendar services like Google Calendar and Outlook.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PCMS provides a web-based interface and mobile applications for user access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PCMS supports desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PCMS uses REST APIs to interface with external systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PCMS sends reminders via email, SMS, and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PCMS optimizes storage by syncing data regularly.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PCMS enables users to manage events, view schedules, and receive reminders.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PCMS customizes notifications and sharing based on user preferences.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PCMS integrates with third-party calendar and task management tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PCMS allows event creation, syncing with external calendars, and managing availability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PCMS serves individuals, students, professionals, and other users.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PCMS requires an internet connection for syncing and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PCMS depends on calendar APIs, reliable network, and secure authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall let users create and manage events, set reminders, and view events.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with Google Calendar and Outlook for event syncing.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall allow users to share calendars with configurable permissions.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall let users create, edit, and delete events with date, time, and reminders. (REQ-INTF-001)
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall let users set availability and share it with others. (REQ-INTF-003)
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide reminders across devices for scheduled events. (REQ-INTF-001)

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for managing events and calendars.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow calendar views in daily, weekly, or monthly formats.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall sync events with external calendars with minimal delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store event, availability, and calendar data.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support cross-platform functionality, ensuring compatibility across devices.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for handling personal data.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall use encrypted communication for event data syncing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Test event creation, syncing, reminder notifications, and sharing functionality across platforms.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, system documentation, API documentation, and privacy policy.
[SEC] 5. References: Calendar management best practices, GDPR compliance, and cross-platform development standards.
